how_it_works.subtitle: Our AI technology analyzes content in three simple steps

step1.description:
Insert the content you want to verify in the field below
The more complete the text, the more accurate the analysis will be.

step2.title: Automatic Analysis
step2.description: Our AI analyzes the content for signs of misinformation

step3.title: Get the Result
step3.description: Get a detailed analysis about the content's credibility

textarea_label: Type or paste the text you want to verify here:
textarea_placeholder: Example: The COVID-19 vaccine contains microchips...

items.0: Check if the website is known and reliable
items.1: Look for information about the news author
items.2: Verify if other respected outlets published the same content
items.3: Be wary of sites with names very similar to known portals

items.0: Check when the news was originally published
items.1: Watch for old content being reposted as new
items.2: Consider if the temporal context makes sense
items.3: Look for more recent updates on the subject

items.0: Look for the same news in different media outlets
items.2: Check if there's consensus among reliable sources
items.3: Be suspicious when only one site is reporting something "bombshell"

items.0: Do a reverse image search on Google
items.1: Check if the image was manipulated or taken out of context
items.2: Look for the original source of the video
items.3: Observe details like date, location and visual elements that may indicate manipulation

footer.about_text: This project was developed with the mission to combat misinformation and stimulate critical thinking. It is the final work for the course 'Algorithm, Politics and Society', taught by Professor Dr. Paulo Fonseca at the Federal University of Bahia.
